channel.title: .ISO question (new question)
channel.description:
Well, im making an .iso of a concert i have on dvd, but if i burn that .iso on another dvd, can i watch it on a dvd player? thanks in advance That was the first question, now the second.
Ok i have the .iso on my computer, but is there any way to make it smaller, because it doesnt fit on a dvd :(.

item.title: .ISO question (new question)
item.dc:creator: @Sean Sean
item.description:
@Sean wrote:

As popcorn said, this is regarding the dvds you use to burn it off and how ‘gay’ your player is about these types of disks. You can get better quality disks etc to try and work around this thou.

Just remember, an iso is an image of a cd, it contains the EXACT same information as on the original cd. If you burn the image onto a blank cd, that cd will contain the EXACT same information on it as the original disk. So in theory its sound, media and players are where the issues come in.

Oh and remember, some dvds you buy from shops etc MAY be larger than the media you are using for the copy.

nb: media == blank cds/dvds etc.

Read full topic

ok thanks.

It depends on the player and the DVDs you use.

item.title: .ISO question (new question)
item.dc:creator: @Smegman Smegman
item.description:
@Smegman wrote:

as long as you burn the image, not as a data cd (dont burn the iso file onto the dvd)
